sect1.title: Configuring the setclock script
sect1.para: This setclock script reads the time from your hardware clock, also known as BIOS or CMOS (Complementry Metal-Oxide Semiconductor) clock, and either converts that time to localtime using the /etc/localtime file (if the hardware clock is set to GMT) or not (if the hardware clock is already set to localtime). There is no way to auto-detect whether the hardware clock is set to GMT or not, so we need to configure that here ourselves.
Change the value of the UTC variable below to a 0 (zero) if your hardware clock is not set to GMT time.
